  1. City Council

City Council

Pictured (left to right):  Blane Williams, Brad Maule, Randy Johnson, Kathleen Belanger, Chad Huckaby

City Council meetings are typically held on the first and third Tuesday of each month in the Council Chamber of Nacogdoches City Hall, located at 202 East Pilar Street, unless otherwise noted. Agendas showing meeting dates, locations, and start times are posted a week prior to each regularly scheduled Council meeting. Please note – Council may occasionally call special meetings or workshops on dates other than the first and third Tuesday of each month.

  • Randy Johnson – Mayor (term expires 2027)
  • Kathleen Belanger – Council Member, Northeast Ward (term expires 2027)
  • Brad Maule – Council Member, Northwest Ward (term expires 2027)
  • Chad Huckaby – Council Member, Southwest Ward (term expires 2026)
  • Blane Williams – Council Member, Southeast Ward (term expires 2026)

The City of Nacogdoches has a council-manager form of government, which combines strong political leadership, representative democracy through elected officials, and professional management. Under this form, members of Council set the municipal government policies while the City Manager, who is appointed by Council, assumes administrative responsibility of municipal government operations. As determined by the city charter , Nacogdoches City Council consists of five members – one member elected by each of the four wards and one member elected at-large as Mayor – for terms of two years each.

The Nacogdoches City Council welcomes public comments at regularly scheduled meetings. In addition to public comments on meeting agenda items, Council offers an open forum whereby citizens may comment on governance issues over which the City of Nacogdoches has domain.
